intro: Acetosa bidentula, commonly known as the two-toothed sorrel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible properties. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and heart-shaped leaves with a serrated edge. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom in early summer. Acetosa bidentula is often found in moist meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in well-drained soil.
